intro: Poponax macracantha, commonly known as the giant sandbur, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is known for its tall, spiny stems and produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Poponax macracantha is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
